intro: Jacea razgradensis, commonly known as the Razgrad bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Bulgaria. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is listed as endangered due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
